no longer be compatible with 0.1 version of Sabre.

title: Update Running a Sabre Smart Contract doc
body:
Rewrite to expand, clarify, update, edit, and format information. Changes include:

- Rewrite throughout to clarify information, make consistent with procedures in
  the Sawtooth core docs, and format as a procedure

- Add introduction and prerequisites sections

- Summarize what the Docker Compose files do (describe containers, key generation,
  Sawtooth administrator setting, and volume setup/key sharing between containers)

- Consistently show which container is used for each step

- Clarify that "sabre upload" uploads a contract definition file (not a
  contract) and that "sabre ns" creates a namespace registry (not a namespace)

- Update the example contract definition file, with explanations of the Sabre
  and Pike namespaces (in source but not shown in the previous doc)

- Delete hard-coded, out-of-date CLI help; replace with info on running the
  command with the --help option

- Summarize what items must be in place before running "sabre exec"

- Add final step to shut down the Sawtooth Sabre environment

Signed-off-by: Anne Chenette <chenette@bitwise.io>

title: C033 sabre pike integration
body:
PR Accomplishes the following

1) Integration Smart Permissions into sabre (closes [issue 217](https://git.cglcloud.com/DigitalSupplyChain/product-core/issues/217))

2) Converts Pike into a smart contract (closes [issue 216](https://git.cglcloud.com/DigitalSupplyChain/product-core/issues/216))

### Testing

1) spin up containers
```
docker-compose -f docker-compose.yaml -f example/intkey_multiply/docker-compose.yaml up -V
```

2) Create intkey data

```
docker exec -it sabre-shell bash
intkey set B 5 --url http://rest-api:9708
intkey set C 10 --url http://rest-api:9708
intkey list --url http://rest-api:9708
exit
```

3) Create inteky multiply payload

```
docker exec -it intkey-multiply-cli bash
intkey-multiply multiply A B C --output payload
exit
```

4) Create Webassembly artifacts

```
docker exec -it sabre-cli bash
rustup target add wasm32-unknown-unknown --toolchain nightly
cd /project/example/intkey_multiply/processor
cargo +nightly build --target wasm32-unknown-unknown --release
cd /project/contracts/sawtooth-pike/tp
cargo +nightly build --target wasm32-unknown-unknown --release
cd /project/contracts/sawtooth-pike/examples/intkey/
cargo +nightly build --target wasm32-unknown-unknown --release
cd /project/cli
```

5) Upload and configure pike smart contract

```
sabre upload --filename ../contracts/sawtooth-pike/pike.yaml --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre ns --create cad11d --owner $(cat /root/.sawtooth/keys/root.pub) --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre perm cad11d pike --read --write --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
```

6) Upload and configure intkey multiply smart contract

```
sabre upload --filename ../example/intkey_multiply/intkey_multiply.yaml --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre ns --create 1cf126 --owner $(cat /root/.sawtooth/keys/root.pub) --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre ns --create 00ec03 --owner $(cat /root/.sawtooth/keys/root.pub) --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre perm 1cf126 intkey_multiply --read --write --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre perm cad11d intkey_multiply --read --write --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
sabre perm 00ec03 intkey_multiply --read --write --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
```

7) Create organization in pike

```
../contracts/sawtooth-pike/cli/target/debug/pike-cli org create Cargill000 Cargill Address --output create_org
sabre exec --contract pike:1.0 --payload ./create_org --inputs cad11d  --outputs cad11d  --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
```

8) Create intkey smart permission

```
sabre sp --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100 create Cargill000 test --filename /project/contracts/sawtooth-pike/examples/intkey/target/wasm32-unknown-unknown/release/intkey.wasm
```

9) Send intkey multiply payload

```
sabre exec --contract intkey_multiply:1.0 --payload /project/example/intkey_multiply/cli/payload  --inputs 1cf126 cad11d 00ec03  --outputs 1cf126  --url http://rest-api:9708 --wait 100
```

title: Update build.rs files to use Customize::default()
body:
Protobuf updated and removed Default::default() and
instead we need to use Customize::default()

Signed-off-by: Andrea Gunderson <agunde@bitwise.io>

Note sabre will not build until sawtooth core is updated.

title: Run tutorial in installed mode and docs updates
body: This PR updates the docker-compose-installed.yaml file to be able to run the tutorial of the documentation in `installed` mode. It makes it closer to the non-installed docker-compose.yaml file. The PR also includes separate commits for some minor documentation revisions and typos in comments or error message in rust files.

body: This PR address several comments left by @dcmiddle during the Sabre RFC process.

title: Bump protobuf version to 2 globally
body:
Fixes internal Sabre consistency issue, where some parts of the code had
`protobuf = "1.4"` and some had `protobuf = "2"`.

Specifying both versions leads to conflicts when building due to some
changes in the library between those two versions ("Perhaps two
different versions of crate `protobuf` are being used?").

Signed-off-by: Kenneth Koski <knkski@bitwise.io>

title: Update Sabre to work with the new get_state/set_state

This should not be merged until https://github.com/hyperledger/sawtooth-core/pull/1722 is merged into sawtooth core.

title: Make --wait optional in sabre cli
body:

it would panic. Now it defaults to 0 if wait
is not provided and returns a UserError if wait is
not an integer.
